name: The Spectacular Sasquatch Online Trivia | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: For which American football team did Langowski play?
questions.explanation:
The Green Bay Packers.

	Sasquatch first appeared in 1979's "Uncanny X-Men" #120. In the eleventh issue of "Alpha Flight" in 1984, it was revealed that he played for three years before resuming studies.

questions.text: At which university did Langowski teach?
questions.explanation:
McGill University.

	These details were revealed in the tenth and eleventh issues of "Alpha Flight", debuting in 1984. Langowski earned his Ph.D. at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

questions.text: In the initial outings with the newly-formed Alpha Flight, with which other member does Langowski begin a relationship?
questions.explanation:
Aurora.

	Their relationship hit some snags in the form of Aurora's overprotective brother, Aurora's split personality, and Langowski's struggles with his bestial nature. Their relationship began in the third and fourth issues of "Alpha Flight", released in 1984.

questions.text: Heroes have endured some terrible injuries, and Sasquatch is no exception! Who ripped out his heart?
questions.explanation:
Snowbird.

	A semi-goddess, Snowbird learned that the source of Sasquatch's bestial rages were mystical in nature. She knew that the only way to stop Sasquatch's tantrums were to kill him, so she transformed into a female sasquatch and ripped his heart out. These events happened in 1985's 23rd issue of "Alpha Flight".

questions.text: Following the demise of his physical body, Langowski inhabited a number of bodies. Which one did he NOT have control of at one time?
questions.explanation:
Jackson Jarvis.

	Langowski found himself in the Box armor in "Alpha Flight" #24, and the Hulk entered the fray in issue #27. Langowski finally snuck into Smart Alec's body in issue #44. That's a long time to be dead!

questions.text: When Langowski finally found a body to inhabit, there was one snag. What was the error?
options: Langowski's new body was not even human
Langowski's new body was that of a baby
questions.explanation:
Langowski's new body was female.

	In a battle with a possessed Snowbird, Langowski switched into her body from the Box armor. When he transformed back into a human form, he found out that he was a woman! Renaming himself Wanda, Langowski sought to retain his (or her) good humor and intelligence. This shocking event happened in the 46th issue of "Alpha Flight".

questions.text: When Langowski was returned to his rightful male body, which villain was Alpha Flight battling?
questions.explanation:
The Dream Queen.

	A disembodied Snowbird appeared to Langowski, under the Dream Queen's control, and used what little power she had to restore Langowski to his rightful body. The possessive spell broken, Langowski quickly transformed to his orange state and defeated the Dream Queen in the 70th issue of "Alpha Flight".

questions.text: Sasquatch assembled a new Alpha Flight to battle the alien, Plodex. What happened to this new team?
options: They retired to train new superheroes
questions.explanation:
They died in battle.

	A mutant named Michael Pointer absorbed the Collective, the combined power of fifty mutants. This power murdered many people, among them the new Alpha Flight. Sasquatch was the sole survivor of the attack, which happened in "New Avengers" #16.

questions.text: Sasquatch joined a new group of superheroes called Omega Flight. Whom did they fight in their mini-series?
questions.explanation:
The Wrecking Crew.

	Empowered by the Great Beasts, the Wrecking Crew easily defeated Sasquatch and needed the entire team to defeat them. These events were chronicled in the six-issue run of "Omega Flight", debuting in 2007.

questions.text: In the "Exiles" series, who is Sasquatch?
questions.explanation:
Heather Hudson.

	An alternate version of Heather had married Wolverine and then James MacDonald Hudson after Wolverine's death. She lost her powers but still aided the team by providing important information during battle. These events happened in the tenth issue of "Exiles" in 2006.
